required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Low Dose Vasopressin in Traumatic Shock
clinical_study.official_title: Prospective, Randomized, Double-Blind, Multi-Center Trial of Low Dose Vasopressin Versus Placebo in Traumatic Shock Resuscitation

lead_sponsor.agency: The University of Texas Health Science Center at San Antonio

clinical_study.source: The University of Texas Health Science Center at San Antonio

brief_summary.textblock: Hypothesis: We hypothesize that resuscitation regimens which minimize the total volume of resuscitation fluid, while restoring organ perfusion, will lead to lower morbidity and mortality in critically ill patients following trauma.

primary_outcome.measure: The Primary Endpoint of This Study Will be Day 30 Mortality.

secondary_outcome.measure: Secondary Objective is to Better Understand the Efficacy of Novel Endpoints of Resuscitation in the Management of Shock and the Ability of These Monitors to Predict Outcome After Trauma.

arm_group.description: bolus of NS followed by continuous infusion of NS, no vasopressin added

intervention.description: no vasopressin added to bolus or 5 hour continuous infusion
vasopressin bolus 4 units followed by continuous infusion 2.4units/hr for 5 hours

overall_official.affiliation: The University of Texas Health Science Center at San Antonio

facility.name: University of Texas Health Science Center at San Antonio

link.description: Department of Surgery Web Page, Vasopressin presentation

results_reference.citation: Cohn SM, McCarthy J, Stewart RM, Jonas RB, Dent DL, Michalek JE. Impact of low-dose vasopressin on trauma outcome: prospective randomized study. World J Surg. 2011 Feb;35(2):430-9. doi: 10.1007/s00268-010-0875-8.

participant_flow.recruitment_details: recruitment location - Emergency room Feb 2007- Feb 2009
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: clinical indication prohibiting potential use of vasopressin.

group.title: Normal Saline
group.description: bolus of NS followed by continuous infusion of NS, no vasopressin added normal saline control : no vasopressin added to bolus or 5 hour continuous infusion

group.title: Vasopressin
group.description: Vasopressin vasopressin : vasopressin bolus 4 units followed by continuous infusion 2.4units/hr for 5 hours

baseline.population: Vasopressin enrolled 40 and two withdrawn and never received drug (38) Normal saline enrolled 41 and one withdrawn and never received drug (40)

group.title: Normal Saline
group.description: bolus of NS followed by continuous infusion of NS, no vasopressin added normal saline control : no vasopressin added to bolus or 5 hour continuous infusion

group.title: Vasopressin
group.description: Vasopressin vasopressin : vasopressin bolus 4 units followed by continuous infusion 2.4units/hr for 5 hours

outcome.title: The Primary Endpoint of This Study Will be Day 30 Mortality.

group.title: Normal Saline
group.description: Administration of Normal Saline as a placebo

group.title: Vasopressin
group.description: Administration of Vasopressin as the intervention

measure.title: The Primary Endpoint of This Study Will be Day 30 Mortality.

outcome.title: Secondary Objective is to Better Understand the Efficacy of Novel Endpoints of Resuscitation in the Management of Shock and the Ability of These Monitors to Predict Outcome After Trauma.

reported_events.time_frame: Reported Adverse Events (AEs) include events starting on or after Day 0 or before Day 30

group.title: Normal Saline
group.description: bolus of NS followed by continuous infusion of NS, no vasopressin added normal saline control : no vasopressin added to bolus or 5 hour continuous infusion

group.title: Vasopressin
group.description: Vasopressin vasopressin : vasopressin bolus 4 units followed by continuous infusion 2.4units/hr for 5 hours

event.description: Pulseless electrical activity, pulseless ventricular tachycardia, supraventricular tachycardia, intermittent

certain_agreements.pi_employee: All Principal Investigators ARE employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.

point_of_contact.organization: University of Texas Health Science Center at San Antonio
